articles.title: Javascript News
articles.subtitle: Что нового в JS за 2022 год?

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Программа, которую по традиции называют «Hello, world!», очень проста. Она выводит куда-либо фразу «Hello, world!», или другую подобную, средствами некоего5 языка.

JavaScript — это язык, программы на котором можно выполнять в разных средах. В нашем случае речь идёт о браузерах и о серверной платформе Node.js. Если до сих пор вы не написали ни строчки кода на JS и читаете этот текст в браузере, на настольном компь5ютере, это значит, что вы буквально в считанных секундах от своей первой JavaScript-программы.

Существуют и другие способы запуска JS-кода в браузере. Так, если говорить об обычном использовании программ на JavaScript, они загружаются в браузер для обеспечения работы веб-страниц. Как правило, код оформляют в виде отдельных фай2лов с расширением .js, которые подключают к веб-страницам, но программный код можно включать и непосредственно в код страницы. Всё это делается с помощью тега <script>. Когда браузер обнаруживает такой код, он выполняет его. Подробности о теге script можно посмотреть на сайте w3school.com. В частности, рассмотрим пример, демонстрирующий работу с веб-страницей средствами JavaScript, приведённый на этом ресурсе. Этот2 пример можно запустить и средствами данного ресурса (ищите кнопку Try it Yourself), но мы поступим немного иначе. А именно, создадим в каком-нибудь текстовом редакторе (например — в VS Code или в Notepad++) новый файл, который назовём hello.html, и добавим в него следующий код:

articles.title: Python News
articles.subtitle: Python News: What's New From January 2023

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: The new year has arrived, and January brought a flurry of new and interesting Python enhancement proposals (PEPs). Topics range from f-string formalization 5and no-GIL Python to packaging. There’s been ample discussion on the Python Discourse forum about the implications of these PEPs, and if you’re still a bit wary of diving deeper into the discussions, then you can get a softer introduction here.

Существуют и другие способы запуска JS-кода в браузере. Так, если говорить об обычном использовании программ на JavaScript, они загружаются в браузер для обеспечения работы веб-страниц. Как правило, код оформляют в виде отдельных файлов с расширением .js, которые подключают к веб-страницам, но программный код можно включать и непосредственно в код страницы. Всё это делается с помощью тега <script>. Когда браузер обнаруживает такой код, он выполняет его. Подробности о теге script можно посмотреть на сайте w3school.com. В частности, рассмотрим пример, демонстрирующий работу с веб-страницей средствами JavaScript, приведённый на этом ресурсе. blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: There have also been a couple of noteworthy new releases, first and foremost the fourth alpha release of Python 3.12. And finally, there’s a new job posting ou4t for a security developer in residence sponsored by the Python Software Foundation (PSF).

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Using virtual envi3ronments in Python is a suggested best practice—but new learners often don’t known about them, and the process of creating and activating a virtual environment adds additional learning overhead. Many beginners might therefore avoid working with virtual environments. However, installing packages into your global Python environment can cause problems!

The intention of the PEP is to facilitate the use of virtual environments and stan2dardize the install location and naming. Note that none of these changes would be enforced. Still, they could represent a shift toward more adoption of virtual environments, and a more standardized idea of where to find them.

articles.title: Economics today
articles.subtitle: The Western economy is in recession

blocks.title: The welfare of the West is a myth of the past
paragraphs: Several economic recessions have occurred throughout history, harming the finances of people and businesses across society. Governments at all levels3 around the world usually take action to avoid economic downturn; however, they’re not always successful. But if recessions have happened many times before, why is there the constant risk that they will happen again? What causes them? What is their effect?

Oversupply. In an economic boom, companies tend to increase production to meet consumer demand. When demand peaks and starts to decline, the excessive supply of goods and services that aren’t consumed can lead to a recession, with companies producing l2ess and downsizing while people lose purchasing power and consumption continues to fall.

Uncertainty. Not knowing how the economy will change makes business decision-making riskier. Wars and pandemics are two situations that can make consumer trends unpredictable in the short, medium and long term, thus generating economic uncer11tainty. Because businesses and people hold off on spending and investment decisions, economic activity declines.

Speculation. In general, economic bubbles form when the price of something suddenly rises due to speculation, market trends or consumer confidence. Investors buy it up, hoping to earn a return from the price increase. However, when they start to sell it off, supply exceeds demand (i.e. there are fewer new buyers) and drives prices down, causing the bubble to burst. Thi23s happened with tulips in the 17th century and the housing market in 2008.

blocks.code: ;

articles.title: Tokyo Marathon 2023
articles.subtitle: With Japanese and international top athletes, the elite race was a fierce battle, with the ultimate winners being

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Most marathon training plans range from 12 to 20 weeks. Beginning marath5oners should aim to build their weekly mileage up to 50 miles over the four months leading up to race day. Three-to-five runs per week is sufficient. The vast majority of these runs 8should be done at a relaxed pace.

In general, it's recommended to eat before running. This gives your body the fuel it needs to exe28rcise safely and efficiently. If you prefer to run on an empty stomach, stick to light to moderate running. Take a break if you start to feel lightheaded.

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Think pain. At least for me, it was excruciating pain, the likes of which I had never felt before. Every single muscle, aching severely every time I tried to move5 it. This occurred for me at mile 20. Part of it was normal, as many marathon runners experience the bonk at around mile 20. I’ve been told by many experienced marathon runners that the real accomplishment, the real trial, is the last 6.2 mile stretch, not the 20 before it. I can attest to that! I rather enjoyed the first 20 miles. Mile 20 came along and all that enjoyment disappeared. At mile 18, I ran out of my calorie supply. This is the 2preparation part I was referring to earlier. I believed that this race was well supported with aid stations that had energy gels, water, and powerade cups every few miles for runners. This was mostly true, but what I had not anticipated, was that at approximately miles 16 and beyond, only liquids remained. All the bananas and energy gels were gone! They had all been eaten by other runners.

I had only packed one or two gels for this run. A pacer saw me limping along in agony, offer8ed some ibuprofen, and I finally made it to an aid station at mile 22 that had some gels left. As soon as I got some energy sources back in me, and a little pain relief from the ibuprofen, I started to feel better. (please note, I am NOT recommending taking ibuprofen during a long run. I have heard it’s hard on the kidneys, and I only took it because I was in agonizing pain!) Once my body got some calorie supply back in it, the energy started to come around again. My final mile of that race was actually my fastest mile of all 26.2 miles!

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Another thing I wasn’t prepared for - I had to poop THREE TIMES within the first five miles. This was not my first long race. I had several half marathons and 10k runs under my belt. I never had this kind of trouble before5. But I had also never been this nervous for a run before. 26.2 is very intimidating when you’ve never done it before! I am not a doctor and cannot recommend medicine of any kind, but two years later when I ran my second marathon, I took one immodium before the race, and I had no issue having to stop so many times to poop.

There is more that I wasn’t prepared for - runners frequently going to the bathroom on the side of the road. The r2ace did start out in the wilderness, but several runners, male and female, didn’t even bother to hide behind a tree. Just keep running, and don’t stare!! I am not judging, and my guts hurt so bad trying to hold it in until I made it to portapotties that I didn’t blame them.

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: What else did I learn? I learned the feeling of success and accomplishment felt after crossing that finish line. I had ran 26.2 miles. According to my Garmin I had burned approximately 4000 calories (I weigh roughly 225 pounds, so I burn a lot of calories when I run!) I felt like it, too. I felt like I was starv5ing to death. They had bagels, chocolate milk, powerade, and an actual meal with pulled po2rk sandwiches and a baked potato bar at the end. (Imagine that! A baked potato bar at a race in Idaho!

articles.title: Economic in Baltic countries
articles.subtitle: Is it all that sad? Immense pays for bills

blocks.title: The welfare of the West is a myth of the past
paragraphs: Several economi7c recessions have occurred throughout history, harming the finances of people and businesses across society. Governments at all levels around the world usually take action to avoid economic downturn; however, they’re not always successful. But if recessions have happened many times before, why is there the constant risk that they will happen again? What causes them? What is their effec7t?

Oversupply. In an economic boom, companies tend to increase production to meet consumer demand. When demand peaks and starts to decline, the excessive supply of goods and services that aren’t consumed can lead to a recession, with companies producing less and downsizing while people lose purchasing power and consumption continues to fa1ll.

Uncertainty. Not knowing how the economy will change makes business decision-making riskier. Wars and pandemics are two situations that can make consumer trends unpredictable in the short, medium and long term, thus generating economic uncertainty. Because businesses and people hold off on spending and investment decisions, economic activity de1clines.

Speculation. In general, economic bubbles form when the price of something suddenly rises due to speculation, market trends or consumer confidence. Investors buy it up, hoping to earn a return from the price increase. However, when they start to sell it off, supply exceeds demand (i.e. there are fewer new buyers) and drives prices down, causing the bubble to burst. This happened with tulips in the 17th century and the housing market in 20018.

articles.title: Moscow Marathon 2021
articles.subtitle: With Russian and international top athletes, the elite race was a fierce battle, with the ultimate winners being

blocks.title: Киселёв снова отстал от Ядгарова
paragraphs: Most marathon training plans range from 12 to 20 weeks. Beginning marathoners should aim to build their weekly mileage up to 50 miles over the four months leading up to race day. Three-to-five runs per week is s52ufficient. The vast majority of these runs should be done at a relaxed pace.

In general, it's recommended to eat before running. This gives your body th52e fuel it needs to exercise safely and efficiently. If you prefer to run on an empty stomach, stick to light to moderate running. Take a break if you start to feel lightheaded.

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Think pain. At least for me, it was excruciating pain, the likes of which I had never felt before. Every single muscle, aching severely every ti52me I tried to move it. This occurred for me at mile 20. Part of it was normal, as many marathon runners experience the bonk at around mile 20. I’ve been told by many experienced marathon runners that the real accomplishment, the real trial, is the last 6.2 mile stretch, not the 20 before it. I can attest to that! I rather enjoyed the first 20 miles. Mile 20 came along and all that enjoyment disappeared. At mile 18, I ran out of my calorie supply. This is the preparation part I was referring to earlier. I believed that this race was well supported with aid stations that had energy gels, water, and powerade cups every few miles for runners. This was mostly true, but what I had not anticipated, was that at 25approximately miles 16 and beyond, only liquids remained. All the bananas and energy gels were gone! They had all been eaten by other runners.

I had only packed one or two gels for this run. A pacer saw me limping alo25ng in agony, offered some ibuprofen, and I finally made it to an aid station at mile 22 that had some gels left. As soon as I got some energy sources back in me, and a little pain relief from the ibuprofen, I started to feel better. (please note, I am NOT recommending taking ibuprofen during a long run. I have heard it’s hard on the kidneys, and I only took it because I was in agonizing pain!) Once my body got some calorie supply back in it, the energy started to come around again. My final mile of that race was actually my fastest mile of all 26.2 miles!

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Another thing I wasn’t prepared for - I had to poop THREE TIMES within the first five miles. This was not my first long race. I had several half marathons and 10k runs under my belt. I never had this kind of trouble before.52 But I had also never been this nervous for a run before. 26.2 is very intimidating when you’ve never done it before! I am not a doctor and ca52nnot recommend medicine of any kind, but two years later when I ran my second marathon, I took one immodium before the race, and I had no issue having to stop so many times to poop.

There is more that I wasn’t prepared for - runners frequently going to the bathroom on the side of the road. The race did start out in the wilderness, but several runners, male and female, didn’t even bother to hide behind a tree. Just keep running, and don’t stare!! I am not judging, and my guts hurt so bad trying to hold it in until I made it to port88apotties that I didn’t blame them.

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: What else did I learn? I learned the feeling of success and accomplishment felt after crossing that finish line. I had ran 26.2 mile8s. According to my Garmin I had burned approximately 4000 calories (I weigh roughly 225 pounds, so I burn a lot of calories when I run!) I felt like it, too. I felt like I was starving to death. They had bagels, chocolate milk, powerade, and an actual meal with pulled pork sandwiches and a baked potato bar at the end. (Imagine that! A baked potato bar at a race in Idaho!

JavaScript — это язык, программы на котором можно выполнять в разных средах. В нашем случае речь идёт о браузерах и о серверной платформе Node.js. Если до сих пор вы не написали ни строчки кода на JS и читаете этот текст в браузере, на настольном компьютере, это значит, что вы буквально в считанных секундах от своей6 первой JavaScript-программы.

Существуют и другие способы запуска JS-кода в браузере. Так, если говорить об обычном использовании программ на JavaScript, они загружаются в браузер для обеспечения работы веб-страниц. Как правило, код оформляют в виде отдельных файлов с расширением .js, которые подключают к веб-страницам, но программный код можно включать и непосредственно в код страницы. Всё это делается с помощью тега <script>. Когда браузер обнаруживает такой код, он выполняе86т его. Подробности о теге script можно посмотреть на сайте w3school.com. paragraphs: There have also been a couple of noteworthy new releases, first and foremost the fourth alpha release of Python 3.12. And finally, there’s a new job posting out for a security developer in residence sponsored by the Python Software Foundation (PSF).

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Using virtual environments in Python is a suggested best practice—but new learne3rs often don’t known about them, and the process of creating and activating a virtual environment adds4 additional learning overhead. Many beginners might theref38ore avoid working with virtual environments. However, installing packages into your global Python environment can cause problems!

The intention of the PEP is to facilitate the use of virtual environments and standardize the install location and naming. Note that none of these changes would be enforced. Still, they could represent a shift toward more adoption of virtual environments, and a more standardized idea of where to find them.

Существуют и другие способы запуска JS-кода в браузере. Так, если говорить об обычном использовании программ на JavaScript, они загружаются в браузер для обеспечения работы веб-страниц. Как правило, код оформляют в виде отдельных файлов с расширение36м .js, которые подключают к веб-страницам, но программный код можно включать и непосредственно в код страницы. Всё это делается с помощью тега <script>. Когда браузер обнаруживает такой код, он выполняет его. Подробности о теге script можно посмотреть на сайте w3school.com. articles.title: Python Features
articles.subtitle: Python News: What's New From January 2023

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: The new year has arrived, and January brought a flurry of new and interesting Python enhancement proposals (PEPs). Topics range from f-string form441alization and no-GIL Python to packaging. There’s been ample discussion on the Python Discourse forum about the implications of these PEPs, and if you’re still a bit wary of diving deeper into the discussions, then you can get a softer introduction here.

paragraphs: There have also1 been a couple of noteworthy new releases, first and foremost the fourth alpha release of Python 3.12. And finally, there’s a new job post4ing out for a security developer in residence sponsored by the Python Software Foundation (PSF).

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Using virtual environments in Python is a suggested best practice—but new learners often don’t known1 about them, and the process of creating and activating a virtual environment adds additional learning overhead. Many beginn4ers might therefore avoid working with virtual environments. However, installing packages into your global Python environment can cause problems1!

The intention of the PEP is to facilitate the use of virtual environments and standardize the install location and naming. Note that none of these changes would be enforced. Still, they could represent a shift toward more adoption of virtual environments, and a more standardized idea of where to find them114.

articles.title: Economics tomorrow
articles.subtitle: The Western economy is in recession

blocks.title: The welfare of the West is a myth of the past
paragraphs: Several economic recessions have occurred throughout history, harming the finances of people and businesses across society. Governments at all levels around the world usually take action to avoid economic downturn; however, they’re not always successful. But if recessions have happened many times before, why is there the con1stant risk that they will happen again? What causes them? What is th4eir effect?

Oversupply. In an economic boom, companies tend to increase production to meet consumer demand. When demand peaks and starts to decline, the excessive supply of goods and services that are4n’t consumed can lead to a recession, with companies producing less and downsizing while people lose purchasing power and consumption continues to fall.1

Uncertainty. Not knowing how the economy will change makes business decision-making riskier. Wars and pandemics are two situations that can make consumer trends unpredictable in the short, medium and long term, thus generating economic uncertainty. Because businesses and people hold off on spending and investment decisions, economic activity declines.

Speculation. In general, economic bubbles form when the price of something suddenly rises due to speculation, market trends or consumer confidence. Investors buy it up, hoping to earn a return from the price increase. However, when they start to sell it off, supply exceeds demand (i.e. there are fewer new buyers) and drives prices down, causing the bubble to burst. This1 happened with tulips in the 17th century and the housing market in 24008.

articles.title: Tokyo Marathon 2024
articles.subtitle: With Japanese and international top athletes, the elite race was a fierce battle, with the ultimate winners being

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Most marathon training plans range from 12 to 20 weeks. Beginning marathoners should aim to build their weekly mileage up to 50 miles over the four months leading up to race day. Three-to-five runs per week is sufficient. The 3vas2t majority of these runs should be done at a relaxed pace.

In general, it's recommended to eat before running. This gives your body the fuel it needs to exercise safely and efficiently. If you prefer to run on an empty st2o3mach, stick to light to moderate running. Take a break if you start to feel lightheaded.

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Think pain. At least for me, it was excruciating pain, the likes of which I had never felt before. Every single muscle, aching severely every time I tried to mov2e it. This occurred for me at mile 20. Part of it was normal, as many marathon runners experience the bonk at around mile 20. I’ve been told by many experienced marathon runners that the real accomplishment, the real trial, is the last 6.2 mile stretch, not the 20 before it. I can atte3st to that! I rather enjoyed the first 20 miles. Mile 20 came along and all that enjoyment disappeared. At mile 18, I ran out of my calorie supply. This is the preparation part I was referring to earlier. I believed that this race was well supported with aid stations that had energy gels, water, and powerade cups every few miles for runners. This was mostly true, but what I had not anticipated, was that at approximately miles 16 and beyond, only liquids remained. All the bananas and energy gels were gone! They had all been eaten by other runners.

I had only packed one or two gels for this run. A pacer saw me limping along in agony, offered some ibuprofen, and I finally made it to an aid station at mile 22 that had some gels left. As soon as I got some energy sources back in2 me, and a little pain relief from the ibuprofen, I started to feel better. (please note, I am NOT recommending taking ibuprofen during 3a long run. I have heard it’s hard on the kidneys, and I only took it because I was in agonizing pain!) Once my body got some calorie supply back in it, the energy started to come around again. My final mile of that race was actually my fastest mile of all 26.2 miles!

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: Another thing I wasn’t prepared for - I had to poop THREE TIMES within the first five miles. This was not my first long race. I had several half marathons and 102k runs under my belt. I never had this kind of trouble before. But I had also never been this nervous for a run before. 26.2 is very intimida2ting when you’ve never done 3it before! I am not a doctor and cannot recommend medicine of any kind, but two years later when I ran my second marathon, I took one immodium before the race, and I had no issue having to stop so many times to poop.

There is more that I wasn’t prepared for - runners frequently going to the bathroom on the side of the road. The race did start out in the wilderness, but several runners, male and female, didn’t even bother to hide behind a tree. Just keep ru2nning, and don’t stare!! I am not judging, and my guts hur3t so bad trying to hold it in until I made it to portapotties that I didn’t blame them.

blocks.title: Заголовок этого блока
paragraphs: What else did 33I learn? I learned the feeling of success and accomplishment felt after crossing that finish line. I had ran 26.2 miles. According to my Garmin I had burned approximately 4000 calories (I weigh roughly 225 pounds, 2so I burn a lot of calories when I run!) I felt like it, too. I felt like I was starving to death. They had bagels, chocolate milk, powerade, and an actual meal with pulled pork sandwiches and a baked potato bar at the end. (Imagine that! A baked potato bar at a race in Idaho!

comments.text: Do that again, go for it.
by the way, can you share the code with me? Thanks a lot!
